poem:
"Parted Pages"

When books and finance shared a bed,
Under stark print their vows were said.
But truth's pen grew weary, swift and bold -
Unseen hands fold the tales untold.

Ink ties bind not but break and sever,
Echoes traded for silent forever.
The festival closes, the doors are barred,
Songs of joy turn into shards.

Fires of profit, cool and wane,
In cold parting lies the stain.
